
    Particle-type Dependence of Azimuthal Anisotropy and Nuclear
    Modification of Particle Production in Au+Au Collisions at sqrt(s_NN
    ) = 200 GeV
    J. Adams /et al., /nucl-ex/0306007

------------------------------------------------------------------------


      Figure 1: Minimum bias v_2

The minimum bias (0-80% of the collision cross-section) v_2 (p_T )
Errors listed include statistical and point-to-point systematic
uncertainties from the background. Additional non-flow systematic
uncertainties are approximately -20%.

browser./

      Figure 2: v_2 (p_T ) for 3 centrality bins.

Errors listed include statistical errors only. Additional non-flow
systematic uncertainties for the 30-70%, 5-30%, and 0-5% centralities
are -25%, -20%, and -80% respectively.

      Figure 3: R_CP .

Errors listed include statistical and point-to-point systematic errors.
Overall normalization uncertainties are listed in the heading. Charged
hadron results can be found at this URL
<http://www.star.bnl.gov/afs/rhic/star/doc_public/www/all/physicsdatabase/20/data.html>.

      Figure 4: Minimum bias v_2 /n vs. p_T /n

The minimum bias (0-80% of the collision cross-section) v_2 /n(p_T /n)
from figure 1, scaled by the number of constituent quarks. Errors listed
include statistical and point-to-point systematic uncertainties from the
background. Additional non-flow systematic uncertainties are
approximately -20%.
